page.title: 112357 DYKENEUK AND HALLS FARM
page.content: {LANDSCAPE:-}Most of this area is undulating ground of rough grazing.The deepest valley is that of the{Black {Burn}which flows from W.to E.then N.to join the river{NORTH ESK.}The valley floor is about 15m below the level of the{A701. {TREES:-}Only one small area of trees can be seen in front of the steading of{HALLS FARM.}These are conifers and cover an area of about 0.5 hectares. {FARMING:-}Total area of rough grazing is 440 hectares.{HALLS FARM}has about 200 beef cattle and 200 Blackfaced sheep.The farm steading includes a large{DUTCH}barn and a{BYRE}for the cattle {PEOPLE:-}The number of people in this area is very small and includes the farmer ,a little family and four farm- workers,including a shepherd living at {DYKENEUK COTTAGE
